original_title: Sri Lanka bonds close marginally higher, rupee 319.50/320 to dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka bonds closed marginally higher Tuesday and the rupee was steady, dealers said.
A bond maturing on  01.07.2025 closed at 27.45/75 percent, up from 27.10/30 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2025 closed at 25.75/95 percent, up from 25.40/60 percent.
At the weekly Treasury bill auction 3-month bills rose to 24.80 percent. (Colombo/Apr11/2023)
